ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] fetch the whole web trace from the starting url up to a web given as parameter
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello Enrique, you might be better off using google for your use case, if I understand it correctly. You can search for e.g. site:pornhub.com link:ourdomain .

Hello Enrique, you might be better off using google for your use case,
if I=
 understand it correctly. You can search for e.g.
"site:pornhub.com link:ou=
rdomain". See
https://support.google.com/websearch/answer/2466433?p=3Dadv_p=
ages_similar&hl=3Den&rd=3D1

Noah

On Mon, Oct 26, 2015 at 11:15 AM, 'Ko, L=
auren' lauren.ko@...
[archive-crawler] <archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com=
> wrote:
> Hi Enrique,
> If I understand what you are generally wanting to =
do, you could put together the full trace of URLs from "ourdomain" back to =
one of the seeds just using the crawl log.
>
> The fourth field of a line i=
n the crawl.log is the URI that was downloaded. The sixth field of the line=
 tells you the URI that referred (directly preceded) the downloaded URI giv=
en in the fourth field. So generally, if you find "ourdomain" in the fourth=
 field of a line, then you take the URI in the sixth field of that line and=
 look for that as a fourth field in the crawl.log, you can find its referre=
r and follow back in this pattern until you hit a seed URI. You should know=
 when you get to a seed URI because the sixth field will have a "-" instead=
 of a URI (the discovery path given in the fifth field will also be a "-").=

>
> In this way you can get the particular path that this crawl instance t=
ook from the seed to "ourdomain", though there may be multiple other paths =
existing that the crawler did not take in this instance.
>
> https://webarc=
hive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/Logs explains the fields of the crawl.l=
og and should be able to help you.
>
> Lauren Ko
> UNT Libraries
> ________=
________________________________
> From: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com [a=
rchive-crawler@yahoogroups.com]
> Sent: Monday, October 26, 2015 8:08 AM
> =
To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [archive-crawler] fetch the =
whole web trace from the starting url up to a web given as parameter
>
> He=
llo!
>
>
> I have been working with web crawler Heritrix recently in my com=
pany where i work for and after a while searching and testing it I can't fi=
nd how to solve what we want to do.
>
>
> We want to run heritrix automatic=
ally in cron everyday to crawl a list of webpages (adult content) and what =
we want to do is to check if any link of that webs are pointing to webs on =
our domains list. The difficult part and don't find the way is to log all t=
he trace from the seed web up to that link that points to one our domains. =
I was thinking in when job finishes,  a "grep" script could check if the at=
 least one of our domains are in the destination. In that case showing the =
whole trace
>
>
> As the job's log file stores all the links with some info=
rmation but not the trace, and i have no idea to get that info from WARC fi=
le neither.
>
>
> To clarify more this, If we run a crawl job with seed "po=
rnhub.com" , an example is run an script when job is done to grep "ourdomai=
n"  in the log. We don't want that "pornhub.com", has a banner or link poin=
ting to our domain , so if it finds "ourdomain" in the crawl log it should =
show as a result in another log with the whole trace from start to end:
>
>=

> Is it possible to do this?, or other way?. Feel very stupid with this st=
uff and i am not very good in programming
>
> Thank you very much in advanc=
e. Any help with this would be very appreciated
>
> Enrique.
>
